original_title: Building A Subwoofer Box Out Of Decking Material
original_content:
When you go to build a subwoofer box, wood is the most common choice. When it came to his project, though, [Startup Chuck] decided to go a different route entirely. Rather than the usual plywood or MDF, he decided to try Trex decking instead. Why? He had some lying around, and he suspected it might just sound good.
If youre unfamiliar with it, Trex decking is a composite material made of recycled materials like reclaimed wood and plastic film. The best part, though? Trex decking is twice as dense as MDF. That makes it good for speaker box use because it flexes less and thus absorbs less energy from the subwoofer. [Chuck] walks us through cutting out the parts for the box and the subsequent assembly. Ultimately, its not dissimilar from building a speaker box out of wood; the material is simply not that different—just denser.
[Chuck] also puts his new sub through some quick little tests, demonstrating that minimal vibration is passed through to the enclosure itself. He reports that the final build has a nice, deep sound. Meanwhile, if you dont like working with your hands, you could always 3D-print your speaker enclosures instead. Video after the break.
title: Trexデッキングを使用したサブウーファーボックスの製作
body: スピーカーボックスの製作には木材が一般的だが、[Startup Chuck]はTrexデッキングを選択。Trexは再生木材とプラスチックでできており、密度が高く振動を吸収しにくい。結果は木製のケースと似ているが、深いサウンドが得られる。
titles: Trexデッキングを使用したサブウーファーボックスの製作
再生木材とプラスチックフィルムからできたTrexデッキングの活用
サブウーファーボックスに最適なTrexデッキングの特性
木材とは異なる素材、Trexデッキングによるスピーカーボックスのメリット
手作業が苦手なら3Dプリンターでスピーカーエンクロージャーを製作
